meanings.definition: A container for holding water or other liquids.
meanings.sent1: I filled the bowet with fresh water from the well.
meanings.sent2: The bowet in the kitchen is used for washing dishes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the bowet, spilling water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like water pouring from a bowet.
meanings.sent5: The bowet gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting the clear liquid inside.

meanings.definition: To bend the body forward in greeting or respect.
meanings.sent1: He will bowet to the king when he enters the throne room.
meanings.sent2: The students will bowet to their teacher at the end of the performance.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to bowet, but its circuits malfunctioned, causing it to wobble instead.
meanings.sent4: The trees seemed to bowet in the wind, paying homage to nature's strength.
meanings.sent5: As a sign of respect, she would always bowet before entering the temple.

meanings.definition: A curved weapon for shooting arrows.
meanings.sent1: The archer carefully aimed the bowet at the target.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of heroes wielding powerful bowets in battle.
meanings.sent3: The bowet was so finely crafted that it seemed to hum with power.
meanings.sent4: His words were sharp as the tip of a deadly bowet.
meanings.sent5: The bowet was adorned with intricate carvings, telling tales of ancient hunts.

meanings.definition: A knot tied with two loops and two loose ends.
meanings.sent1: She secured the package with a tight bowet to keep it closed.
meanings.sent2: The bowet in her hair added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed a trick with a disappearing bowet, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a strong bowet, binding them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The bowet on the gift was so beautifully tied that it was almost a shame to untie it.
